FuncDef:
The path verification enable command enables fault detection for a specified SRv6 TE Policy.
The path verification disable command disables fault detection for a specified SRv6 TE Policy.
The undo path verification command deletes the fault detection configuration of a specified SRv6 TE Policy, enabling the device to inherit the srv6-te-policy path verification command configuration in the SRv6 view.
By default, the SRv6 TE policy path verification function is disabled.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To enable fault detection for a specified SRv6 TE Policy, run the path verification enable command. To disable fault detection for a specified SRv6 TE Policy, run the path verification disable command.
If the SRv6 TE Policy view does not have fault detection configuration or the undo path verification command has been run, the srv6-te-policy path verification command configuration in the SRv6 view is inherited.
After fault detection is enabled, The SRPOLICY component check the reachability of the SIDs in the segment list referenced by the SRv6 TE Policy. If they are reachable, the fault detection check of the segment list is up, and vice versa.
